thread.title: Minister: discussions about Condor 'will be had'
thread.title_full: Minister: discussions about Condor 'will be had' | Channel - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Minister: discussions about Condor 'will be had'
text:
The Minister for Commerce and Employment in Guernsey has said discussions about Condor 'will be had'.
It comes after a weekend of disruption to Condor passengers that is still ongoing, after a mechanical issue with the Liberation.
Minister Kevin Stewart says having a discussion about the boat and it's reliability are in Condor's best interests.
Liberation services were cancelled on Saturday and are cancelled tomorrow and yesterday almost 140 cars were left in Poole after the boat was overbooked.
The States signed a 10 year contract with Condor for them to serve the islands, but residents are unhappy with their service so far.
Play video I think discussions around long term suitability and reliability of this vessel will be had. Of course it's in Condor's interest to have them because if they find after this first season that in fact this vessel doesn't operate within their business plan, is not technically reliable, then they won't want to keep it either.
â€“ Kevin Stewart, Minister for Commerce and Employment Last updated Mon 21 Sep 2015 Read more 21 updates Condor Liberation services cancelled after mechanical issues Travel Guernsey Jersey
